translated: The Collection of Long Sayings .
The Discourse on the Peak
Thus have I heard:

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā aṅguttarāpesu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ aḍḍhateḷasehi bhikkhusatehi yena āpaṇaṁ nāma aṅguttarāpānaṁ nigamo tadavasari.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā aṅguttarāpesu cārikam caramānaḥ mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim aḍḍhateḷasehi bhikkhu satehi yena āpaṇam nāma aṅguttarāpānam nigamaḥ tat avasari
translated: At one time the Blessed One was wandering in the Angu-Tumbara country with a large community of monks, with 1,250 monks. He arrived at a town of the Angu-Tumbaras named Apaṇa.
The yogi Keṇiya heard:

original: “samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito aṅguttarāpesu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ aḍḍhateḷasehi bhikkhusatehi āpaṇaṁ anuppatto.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ sakya putto sakya kulā pabbajitaḥ aṅguttarāpesu cārikam caramānaḥ mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim aḍḍhateḷasehi bhikkhu satehi āpaṇam anuppattaḥ
translated: “It seems that the ascetic Gotama—a Sakyan, gone forth from a Sakyan family—has arrived at Apaṇa.

original: Taṁ kho pana bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:
analyzed: tam kha pana bhavantam gotamam evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ
translated: And this good report about Master Gotama has spread:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’ti.
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā ati
translated: ‘Such is he, the Blessed One, perfected one, fully awakened, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, happy one, knower of the world, unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’

original: So imaṁ lokaṁ sadevakaṁ samārakaṁ sabrahmakaṁ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṁ pajaṁ sadevamanussaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti.
analyzed: saḥ imam lokam sa devakam sa mārakam sa brahmakam sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇim pajam sa deva manussam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti
translated: He reveals a spiritual life that is utterly perfect & pure.

original: So dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
analyzed: saḥ dhammam deseti ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjana kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāseti
translated: He teaches the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing, and he reveals a spiritual life that is utterly perfect & pure.🔽It’s a gain for Vesālī, a great gain for Vesālī that the Tathāgata–worthy & rightly self-awakened–is staying in Vesālī’s forest grove at the Capāla Shrine.

original: Sādhu kho pana tathārūpānaṁ arahataṁ dassanaṁ hotī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu kho pana tathārūpānam arahatam dassanam hoti iti
translated: “So then, Keṇiya, you should see the Tathāgata, worthy & rightly self-awakened.”

original: Atha kho keṇiyo jaṭilo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: atha kho keṇiyaḥ jaṭilaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi
translated: Then the coiled-hair ascetic Keṇiya went to the Blessed One and, on arrival, exchanged courteous greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.🔽Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho keṇiyaṁ jaṭilaṁ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi  ekamantam nisinnam kho keṇiyam jaṭilam bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahasesi
translated: After an exchange of friendly greetings & courtesies, he sat to one side.🔽As he was sitting there, the Blessed One instructed, urged, roused, & encouraged him with Dhamma talk.

original: Atha kho keṇiyo jaṭilo bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṁsito bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho keṇiyaḥ jaṭilaḥ bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitaḥ samādapitaḥ samuttejitaḥ sampahasitaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then the coiled-hair ascetic Keṇiya, having been instructed, urged, roused, & encouraged by the Blessed One with Dhamma talk, said to him, “Magnificent, lord! Magnificent! Just as if he were to place upright what was overturned, to reveal what was hidden, to show the way to one who was lost, or to carry a lamp into the dark so that those with eyes could see forms, in the same way has Master Gotama–through many lines of reasoning–made the Dhamma clear.🔽“I go to the Blessed One for refuge, to the Dhamma, and to the Saṅgha of monks.

original: “adhivāsetu me bhavaṁ gotamo svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.🔽Evaṁ vutte, bhagavā keṇiyaṁ jaṭilaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: adhivāsetu me bhavam gotamaḥ svātanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati  evam vutte bhagavā keṇiyam jaṭilam etat avoca
translated: “Please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the Sangha of monks.”

original: “mahā kho, keṇiya, bhikkhusaṅgho aḍḍhateḷasāni bhikkhusatāni; tvañca brāhmaṇesu abhippasanno”ti.🔽Dutiyampi kho keṇiyo jaṭilo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: mahā kho keṇiya bhikkhu saṅghaḥ aḍḍhateḷasāni bhikkhu satāni tvam ca brāhmaṇesu abhippasannaḥ ti  dutiyam pi kho keṇiyaḥ jaṭilaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When he said this, the Buddha replied, “The Sangha of monks is large, with 1,250 monks. And you have confidence in the brahmins.”

original: “kiñcāpi, bho gotama, mahā bhikkhusaṅgho aḍḍhateḷasāni bhikkhusatāni, ahañca brāhmaṇesu abhippasanno;
analyzed: kiñca api bho gotama mahā bhikkhu saṅghaḥ aḍḍhateḷasāni bhikkhu satāni aham ca brāhmaṇesu abhippasannaḥ
translated: A second time Keṇiya said, “Even though the Sangha of monks is large, with 1,250 monks, and even though I have confidence in the brahmins,

original: adhivāsetu me bhavaṁ gotamo svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu me bhavam gotamaḥ svātanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the Sangha of monks.”

original: Dutiyampi kho bhagavā keṇiyaṁ jaṭilaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: dutiyam pi khalu bhagavā keṇiyam jaṭilam etat avoca
translated: A second time the Buddha replied,

original: “mahā kho, keṇiya, bhikkhusaṅgho aḍḍhateḷasāni bhikkhusatāni; tvañca brāhmaṇesu abhippasanno”ti.
analyzed: mahā kho keṇiya bhikkhu saṅghaḥ aḍḍhateḷasāni bhikkhu satāni tvam ca brāhmaṇesu abhippasannaḥ ti
translated: “The Sangha of monks is large, with 1,250 monks. And you have confidence in the brahmins.”

original: Tatiyampi kho keṇiyo jaṭilo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho keṇiyaḥ jaṭilaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: A third time Keṇiya said,🔽“Even though the Sangha of monks is large, with 1,250 monks, and even though I have confidence in the brahmins,

original: “kiñcāpi, bho gotama, mahā bhikkhusaṅgho aḍḍhateḷasāni bhikkhusatāni, ahañca brāhmaṇesu abhippasanno,
analyzed: kiñca api bho gotama mahā bhikkhu saṅghaḥ aḍḍhateḷasāni bhikkhu satāni aham ca brāhmaṇesu abhippasannaḥ
translated: “Even though the Sangha of monks is so large, with 1,250 monks, I still have great confidence in the brahmins.

original: adhivāsetu me bhavaṁ gotamo svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu me bhavam gotamaḥ svātanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: Please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the Sangha of monks.”
The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

original: Atha kho keṇiyo jaṭilo bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā yena sako assamo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā mittāmacce ñātisālohite āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho keṇiyaḥ jaṭilaḥ bhagavataḥ adhivāsanam viditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā yena sakaḥ assamaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā mitta amacce ñāti sālohite āmantesi
translated: Knowing that the Buddha had consented, Keṇiya got up from his seat, went to his own hermitage, and addressed his friends and companions, his relatives and kin:

analyzed: suṇantu me bhavantaḥ mitta amaccāḥ ñāti sālohitā
translated: “Please listen to me, sirs, my friends and companions, my relatives and kin.

original: samaṇo me gotamo nimantito svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena,
analyzed: samaṇaḥ me gotamaḥ nimantitaḥ svātanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena
translated: The ascetic Gotama has been invited by me for tomorrow’s meal together with the Sangha of monks.

analyzed: yena me kāyaveyya avaṭikam kareyyātha ati
translated: Please prepare the food for my body.”

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho keṇiyassa jaṭilassa mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā keṇiyassa jaṭilassa
analyzed: eva bhoti kho keṇiyassa jaṭilassa mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā keṇiyassa jaṭilassa
translated: “Yes, sir,” they replied.

original: paṭissutvā appekacce uddhanāni khaṇanti, appekacce kaṭṭhāni phālenti, appekacce bhājanāni
analyzed: paṭissutvā appekacce uddhanāni khaṇanti appekacce kaṭṭhāni phālenti appekacce bhājanāni
translated: Some of them dug ovens, some chopped wood, some washed dishes,

original: dhovanti, appekacce udakamaṇikaṁ patiṭṭhāpenti, appekacce āsanāni paññāpenti.
analyzed: dhovanti appekacce udakamaṇikam patiṭṭhāpenti appekacce āsanāni paññāpenti
translated: some were washing, some were setting out the seats, and some were preparing the water for drinking and for washing.

original: Keṇiyo pana jaṭilo sāmaṁyeva maṇḍalamāḷaṁ paṭiyādeti.🔽Tena kho pana samayena selo brāhmaṇo āpaṇe paṭivasati, tiṇṇaṁ vedānaṁ pāragū sanighaṇḍukeṭubhānaṁ
analyzed: keṇiyaḥ pana jaṭilaḥ sāmayā iva maṇḍalamāḷam paṭiyāda iti  tena kho pana samayena selaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ āpaṇe paṭivasati tiṇṇam vedānam pāragū
translated: But Keṇiya himself was preparing the stilt house.

analyzed: itihāsa pañcamānam padakaḥ veyyākaraṇaḥ lokāyata mahāpurisa lakkhaṇesu
translated: At that time the brahmin Sela was staying at Apana, skilled in the Three Vedas with their vocabularies, liturgy, phonology, and etymology, and the histories as a fifth; skilled in philology and grammar, and in the world’s signs and marks, a man of wide learning, well-spoken, and confident of speech.

original: anavayo, tīṇi ca māṇavakasatāni mante vāceti.
analyzed: tīṇi ca māṇavaka satāni mante vācā iti
translated: And he was teaching three hundred youths to recite the hymns.

original: Tena kho pana samayena keṇiyo jaṭilo sele brāhmaṇe abhippasanno hoti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena keṇiyaḥ jaṭilaḥ sele brāhmaṇe abhippasanno hoti
translated: At that time Keṇiya was devoted to the brahmin Sela.

original: Atha kho selo brāhmaṇo tīhi māṇavakasatehi parivuto jaṅghāvihāraṁ anucaṅkamamāno anuvicaramāno yena keṇiyassa jaṭilassa assamo tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: atha kho selaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tīhi māṇavaka satehi parivutaḥ jaṅghāvihāram anucaṅkamamānaḥ anuvicaramānaḥ yena keṇiyassa jaṭilassa assamaḥ tena upasaṅkami
translated: Then, as Sela was walking and wandering for exercise, he went to Keṇiya’s hermitage accompanied by three hundred youths.

original: Addasā kho selo brāhmaṇo keṇiyassa jaṭilassa assame appekacce uddhanāni khaṇante …pe… appekacce āsanāni paññapente, keṇiyaṁ pana jaṭilaṁ sāmaṁyeva maṇḍalamāḷaṁ paṭiyādentaṁ.
analyzed: addasā kho selaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ keṇiyassa jaṭilassa assame appekacce uddhanāni khaṇante pe appekacce āsanāni paññapente keṇiyam pana jaṭilam sāmayā iva maṇḍala māḷam paṭiyādenta
translated: Sela saw some people digging the foundations for the sacrificial enclosure, some building the walls, some plastering them, and some laying the bricks, while Keṇiya himself was arranging the sacrificial area.
He asked Keṇiya,

original: “kiṁ nu kho bhoto keṇiyassa āvāho vā bhavissati, vivāho vā bhavissati, mahāyañño vā paccupaṭṭhito, rājā vā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro nimantito svātanāya saddhiṁ balakāyenā”ti?
analyzed: kim nu kho bhoto keṇiyassa āvāhaḥ vā bhavissati vivāhaḥ vā bhavissati mahāyaññaḥ vā paccupaṭṭhitaḥ rājā vā māgadhaḥ seniyaḥ bimbisāraḥ nimantito svātanāya saddhim balakāyena ati
translated: “What is happening, Keṇiya? Are you having a wedding, or a great sacrifice, or is King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha invited for tomorrow’s meal together with his army?”

original: “Na me, bho sela, āvāho vā bhavissati vivāho vā, nāpi rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro nimantito svātanāya saddhiṁ balakāyena;
analyzed: na me bho selaḥ āvāhaḥ vā bhavissati vivāhaḥ vā na api rājā māgadhaḥ seniyaḥ bimbisāraḥ nimantitaḥ svātanāya saddhim balakāyena
translated: “Sela, I’m not having a wedding, nor is King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha invited for tomorrow’s meal together with his army.

original: api ca kho me mahāyañño paccupaṭṭhito.
analyzed: api ca kho me mahā yaññaḥ paccupaṭṭhitaḥ
translated: I’m having a great sacrifice.”

original: Atthi samaṇo gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito aṅguttarāpesu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ aḍḍhateḷasehi bhikkhusatehi āpaṇaṁ anuppatto.🔽Taṁ kho pana bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ …pe…
analyzed: atthi samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ sakya putto sakya kulā pabbajitaḥ aṅguttarāpesu cārikam caramānaḥ mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim aḍḍhateḷasehi bhikkhu satehi āpaṇam anuppatto  tam khalu pana bhavantam gotamam pe
translated: And this Master Gotama has this good reputation:

‘He is a Buddha, perfected and fully awakened, complete in insight and conduct, happy, knower of the world, supreme leader of trainable people to be tamed, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, a Buddha.’

original: So me nimantito svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
analyzed: saḥ me nimantito svātanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: He has accepted an invitation for tomorrow’s meal together with the Saṅgha of monks.”
“Keṇiya, do you say ‘Buddha’?”
“Yes, Sela, I do.”
“Keṇiya, do you say ‘Buddha’?”

analyzed: buddha uti bho sela vadāmi iti
translated: “Yes, Sela, I do.”

analyzed: atha kho selassa brāhmaṇassa etat ahosi
translated: Then Sela thought,

original: “ghosopi kho eso dullabho lokasmiṁ, yadidaṁ buddhoti.
analyzed: ghosaḥ api kho esaḥ dullabhaḥ lokasmi yat idam buddha uti
translated: “It’s hard to find a person in the world who is called ‘Buddha’.

original: Āgatāni kho panamhākaṁ mantesu dvattiṁsamahāpurisalakkhaṇāni, yehi samannāgatassa mahāpurisassa dveva gatiyo bhavanti anaññā.
analyzed: āgatāni kho pana amhākam mantesu dvattisa mahāpurisa lakkhaṇāni yehi samannāgatassa mahāpurisassa dve iva gatiyaḥ bhavanti anaññā
translated: But in our hymns there are thirty-two marks of a great man. If a great man has them, there are only two possible destinies, no other.

original: Sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato.
analyzed: sace agāram ajjhāvasati rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammikaḥ dhamma rājā cāturantaḥ vijitāvī janapadatthāvariya ppatto satta ratana samannāgato
translated: If he lives the home life, he becomes a wheel-turning monarch, a righteous king who rules by the Dhamma, master of the four quarters, all-victorious, who has stabilised his country and possesses the seven treasures.
His are these seven treasures:

original: cakkaratanaṁ, hatthiratanaṁ, assaratanaṁ, maṇiratanaṁ, itthiratanaṁ, gahapatiratanaṁ, pariṇāyakaratanameva sattamaṁ.
analyzed: cakka ratana hatthi ratana assa ratana maṇi ratana itthi ratana gahapati ratana pariṇāyaka ratanam eva sattama
translated: the wheel-treasure, the elephant-treasure, the horse-treasure, the jewel-treasure, the woman-treasure, the steward-treasure, and the counsellor-treasure as the seventh.

original: Parosahassaṁ kho panassa puttā bhavanti sūrā vīraṅgarūpā parasenappamaddanā.🔽So imaṁ pathaviṁ sāgarapariyantaṁ adaṇḍena asatthena dhammena abhivijiya ajjhāvasati.
analyzed: parosahassam kho panassa puttāḥ bhavanti sūrāḥ vīraṅga rūpāḥ para sena ppamaddanāḥ  saḥ imam pathavim sāgara pariyantam a daṇḍena a satthena dhammena abhivijiya ajjhāvasati
translated: He has more than a thousand sons, who are heroes, of heroic stature, conquerors of the hostile army.🔽Having conquered this earth, bounded by the ocean, he dwells, having overcome (opposition) by Dhamma.

original: Sace kho pana agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati, arahaṁ hoti sammāsambuddho loke vivaṭṭacchado.
analyzed: sace kho pana agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajati araham hoti sammāsambuddhaḥ loke vivaṭṭa chadaḥ
translated: But if he goes forth from the home to the homeless life, he becomes an Accomplished One, a Fully Awakened One, who draws back the veil from the world.’

original: Kahaṁ pana, bho keṇiya, etarahi so bhavaṁ gotamo viharati arahaṁ sammāsambuddho”ti?
analyzed: kaham pana bho keṇiya etarahi saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ viharati araham sammāsambuddhaḥ iti
translated: “But, Master Keṇiya, where is Master Gotama, the Accomplished One, the Fully Awakened One, at present staying?”

original: Evaṁ vutte, keṇiyo jaṭilo dakkhiṇaṁ bāhuṁ paggahetvā selaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte keṇiyaḥ jaṭilaḥ dakkhiṇam bāhum paggahetvā selam brāhmaṇam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the coiled-hair ascetic Keṇiya extended his right arm and said to the brahmin Sela:

analyzed: yena isā bho sela nīla vana rājī iti
translated: “Sir, that’s the Nīvaraṇe reed thicket.”

original: Atha kho selo brāhmaṇo tīhi māṇavakasatehi saddhiṁ yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: atha kho selaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tīhi māṇavaka satehi saddhim yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami
translated: Then the brahmin Sela went with three hundred youths to the Blessed One.

original: Atha kho selo brāhmaṇo te māṇavake āmantesi:🔽“appasaddā bhonto āgacchantu, pade padaṁ nikkhipantā.
analyzed: atha kho selaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ te māṇavake āmantesi  appasaddāḥ bhontaḥ āgacchantu pade padam nikkhipantā
translated: Then the brahmin Sela addressed those youths:🔽“Come quietly, sirs, step by step.

original: Durāsadā hi te bhagavanto sīhāva ekacarā.
analyzed: durāsadāḥ hi te bhagavantaḥ sīhāvaḥ ekacarā
translated: For those Blessed Ones are hard to approach, like the king of beasts all alone.

original: Yadā cāhaṁ, bho, samaṇena gotamena saddhiṁ manteyyaṁ, mā me bhonto antarantarā kathaṁ opātetha;
analyzed: yadā ca āha bho samaṇena gotamena saddhim manteyya mā me bhontaḥ antar antarā katham
translated: And when I am conversing with the recluse Gotama, sirs, do not interrupt from here and there.

analyzed: kathā pariyosānam me bhavantaḥ āgamentu uti
translated: Wait until the end of the conversation, sirs, and then you can come.”

original: Atha kho selo brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: atha kho selaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi
translated: Then the brahmin Sela went to the Blessed One and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: When this courteous and amiable talk was finished, he sat down at one side

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho selo brāhmaṇo bhagavato kāye dvattiṁsamahāpurisalakkhaṇāni samannesi.🔽Addasā kho selo brāhmaṇo bhagavato kāye dvattiṁsamahāpurisalakkhaṇāni yebhuyyena ṭhapetvā dve.
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho selaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavato kāye dvattisa mahāpurisa lakkhaṇāni samannesi  addasā kho selaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavato kāye dvattisa mahāpurisa lakkhaṇāni yebhuyyena ṭhapetvā dve
translated: As he was sitting there, he examined the Blessed One’s body for the thirty-two marks of a Great Man.🔽He saw all of them except for two,

original: Dvīsu mahāpurisalakkhaṇesu kaṅkhati vicikicchati nādhimuccati na sampasīdati—
analyzed: dvīsu mahāpurisa lakkhaṇesu kaṅkhati vicikicchati na adhimuccati na sampasīdati
translated: which he was unsure of:

analyzed: kosohite ca vattha guyhe pahūta jivha tāya ca ati
translated: the male organ ensheathed like that of a thoroughbred horse and the largeness of the tongue.

original: Atha kho bhagavato etadahosi:🔽“passati kho me ayaṁ selo brāhmaṇo dvattiṁsamahāpurisalakkhaṇāni yebhuyyena ṭhapetvā dve.
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavataḥ  passati kho me ayam selaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ dvattisa mahāpurisa lakkhaṇāni yebhuyyena ṭhapetvā dve
translated: Then the thought occurred to him,🔽“This brahmin Sela sees all of the thirty-two marks of a Great Man on the Blessed One’s body except for two,

original: Dvīsu mahāpurisalakkhaṇesu kaṅkhati vicikicchati nādhimuccati na sampasīdati—
analyzed: dvīsu mahāpurisa lakkhaṇesu kaṅkhati vicikicchati na adhimuccati na sampasīdati
translated: which he is unsure of:

analyzed: kosohite ca vattha guyhe pahūta jivha tāya ca ati
translated: the male organ ensheathed like that of a thoroughbred horse and the largeness of the tongue.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā tathārūpaṁ iddhābhisaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkhāsi, yathā addasa selo brāhmaṇo bhagavato kosohitaṁ vatthaguyhaṁ.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā tathārūpam iddha abhisaṅkhāram abhisaṅkhāsi yathā addasa selaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavataḥ kosohitam
translated: So the Blessed One worked such a feat of supernormal power that Sela saw the Blessed One’s male organ ensheathed like that of a thoroughbred horse.

original: Atha kho bhagavā jivhaṁ ninnāmetvā ubhopi kaṇṇasotāni anumasi paṭimasi, ubhopi nāsikasotāni anumasi paṭimasi, kevalampi nalāṭamaṇḍalaṁ jivhāya chādesi.
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā jivham ninnāmetvā ubho api kaṇṇa sotāni anumasi paṭimasi ubho api nāsika sotāni anumasi paṭimasi kevalam pi nalāṭa maṇḍalam jivhāya chādesi
translated: He then extended his tongue, and with it he stroked and caressed both ear holes and his nose tip, and he covered his entire forehead with his tongue.

analyzed: atha kho selassa brāhmaṇassa etat ahosi
translated: The thought occurred to the brahman:

original: “samannāgato kho samaṇo gotamo dvattiṁsamahāpurisalakkhaṇehi paripuṇṇehi, no aparipuṇṇehi.
analyzed: samannāgataḥ kho samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ dvattisa mahāpurisa lakkhaṇehi paripuṇṇehi no a paripuṇṇehi
translated: “The contemplative Gotama is endowed with the thirty-two marks of a Great Man, complete, not incomplete.

original: No ca kho naṁ jānāmi buddho vā no vā.🔽Sutaṁ kho pana metaṁ brāhmaṇānaṁ vuḍḍhānaṁ mahallakānaṁ ācariyapācariyānaṁ bhāsamānānaṁ:
analyzed: no ca khalu nam jānāmi buddhaḥ vā no vā  sutam kho pana metam brāhmaṇānam vuḍḍhānam mahallakānam ācariya pācariyānam bhāsamānānam
translated: But I don’t know if he is a Worthy One or not.

original: ‘ye te bhavanti arahanto sammāsambuddhā, te sake vaṇṇe bhaññamāne attānaṁ pātukarontī’ti.
analyzed: ye te bhavanti arahantaḥ sammāsambuddhā te sake vaṇṇe bhaññamāne attānam pātukaronti iti
translated: But I have heard from old, elderly brahmans, teachers of teachers, that when there are Worthy Ones, Well-gone Ones in the world, they don’t praise themselves.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ sammukhā sāruppāhi gāthāhi abhitthaveyyan”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham samaṇam gotamam sammukhā sāruppāhi gāthāhi
translated: So why don’t I praise the contemplative Gotama with fitting verses?”

original: Atha kho selo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ sammukhā sāruppāhi gāthāhi abhitthavi:
analyzed: atha kho selaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam sammukhā sāruppāhi gāthāhi
translated: Then the brahman Sela praised the Blessed One with fitting verses right there:
“Your body is complete, very beautiful,
well-born, lovely to behold.
You are golden-skinned, Blessed One,
with beautiful white teeth, and full of energy.
For a man of good birth
who has the characteristics
all of them are on your body,
the marks of a Great Man.
With clear eyes, a beautiful face,
lofty, upright, and radiant,
in the middle of the Saṅgha of monastics
you shine like the sun.
A monk with beautiful eyes,

analyzed: kañcana sannibha ttacaḥ  kim te samaṇa bhāvena
translated: with a head like gold,🔽what is the point of being a monastic
for one with such supreme beauty?

analyzed: rājā arahasi bhavitu  cakka vattī rathesabhaḥ
translated: You should be a king,
a wheel-turning monarch, a lord of the charioteers,🔽conquering the land to the ends of the ocean,
a lord of the Rose-Apple Isle.
The wealthy kings, the aristocrats,
should be your followers.
As a king of kings, a lord of men,
rule, Gotama.”
“I am a king, Sela,
(said the Blessed One)
a unsurpassed king of Dhamma.
By Dhamma I turn the wheel,
a wheel that cannot be turned back.”
“You claim to be fully awakened,
(said Sela the brahmin)
an unsurpassed king of Dhamma.
‘By Dhamma I turn the wheel,’
So you say, Gotama.
Who is your general,
A disciple following the Teacher;
Who follows you,
When the Wheel of Dhamma has been set rolling?”
“The Wheel that I have set rolling,
(said the Fortunate One)
The unsurpassed Wheel of Dhamma;
Sāriputta follows it,
Born after the Realised One.
What should be directly known has been directly known,
What should be developed has been developed,
What should be abandoned by me has been abandoned,
Therefore, brāhmaṇa, I am a Buddha.
Resolve your doubt in me,
Be confident, brāhmaṇa;
It is difficult to see the appearance
Of the Fully Awakened Ones again and again.
For those whose appearance in the world
Is difficult to see again and again;
I am a Buddha, brāhmaṇa,
The unsurpassed doctor.
I am one who has become Brahmā, I am one who has gone beyond,
I am one who has defeated Māra’s army,
Having overcome all enemies,
I rejoice, being free from fear.”
“You should listen to this, venerable sirs,
As the one with vision speaks;
The doctor, the great hero,
Roars like a lion in the forest.
He is the one who has become Brahma, the one who has gone beyond comparison,
He is the one who has become Brahmā, the one who has gone beyond comparison,🔽The one who has defeated Māra’s army.
Who would not be inspired on seeing him,
Even if he is of a dark complexion?
Whoever wishes to follow me,
And whoever wishes to go,
Here I will go forth
In the presence of the one with excellent wisdom.”
“If this is agreeable to you,
In the teaching of the Buddha,
We too will go forth
In the presence of the one with excellent wisdom.”
These three hundred brahmins,
With palms joined, request:
“We will practice the spiritual life
In your presence, Blessed One.”
“The spiritual life is well-proclaimed,
(so said the Blessed One)🔽Visible here and now, timeless.
Where the going forth is not in vain,
For one who trains with diligence.”

original: Alattha kho selo brāhmaṇo sapariso bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, alattha upasampadaṁ.
analyzed: alattha kho selaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ sa parisaḥ bhagavato santike pabbajja alattha upasampada
translated: Sela the brahmin and his assembly received the going forth and the full ordination in the presence of the Buddha.

original: Atha kho keṇiyo jaṭilo tassā rattiyā accayena sake assame paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṁ ārocāpesi:
analyzed: atha kho keṇiyaḥ jaṭilaḥ tassāḥ rattiyāḥ accayena sake assame paṇītam khādanīyam bhojanīyam paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavataḥ kālam ārocāpesi
translated: Then, when the night had passed, Keṇiya had good food of various kinds prepared in his own hermitage. He then had the Buddha informed:🔽“Venerable sir, the meal is ready.

original: “kālo, bho gotama, niṭṭhitaṁ bhattan”ti.🔽Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena keṇiyassa jaṭilassa assamo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena.
analyzed: kālaḥ bho gotama niṭṭhitam bhattanti  atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya yena keṇiyassa jaṭilassa assamaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena
translated: “It’s time, Good Gotama. The meal is ready.”

original: Atha kho keṇiyo jaṭilo buddhappamukhaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi.
analyzed: atha kho keṇiyaḥ jaṭilaḥ buddha ppamukham bhikkhu saṅgham paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi
translated: Then, after robing up in the morning, the Buddha took his bowl and robe and went to Keṇiya’s hermitage, where he sat down on the prepared seat together with the Sangha of monks.🔽Keṇiya personally served various kinds of fine food to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha.

original: Atha kho keṇiyo jaṭilo bhagavantaṁ bhuttāviṁ onītapattapāṇiṁ aññataraṁ nīcaṁ āsanaṁ gahetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho keṇiyaḥ jaṭilaḥ bhagavantam bhuttāvim onīta patta pāṇim aññataram nīcam āsanam gahetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: When the Buddha had finished his meal, Keṇiya took a low seat, sat down to one side,

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho keṇiyaṁ jaṭilaṁ bhagavā imāhi gāthāhi anumodi:🔽“Aggihuttamukhā yaññā,🔽Sāvittī chandaso mukhaṁ;🔽Rājā mukhaṁ manussānaṁ,🔽Nadīnaṁ sāgaro mukhaṁ.🔽Nakkhattānaṁ mukhaṁ cando,🔽Ādicco tapataṁ mukhaṁ;🔽Puññaṁ ākaṅkhamānānaṁ,
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnam kho keṇiyam jaṭilam bhagavā imāhi gāthāhi anumodi 🔽aggi hutta mukhā yaññā 🔽sāvittī chandasaḥ mukha 🔽rājā mukham manussāna 🔽nadīnam sāgaraḥ mukha 🔽nakkhattānam mukham cando 🔽ādiccaḥ tapatam mukha 🔽puññam ākaṅkhamānāna
translated: and the Buddha expressed his appreciation with these verses:
The Sangha is the one who should make the sacrifice.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā keṇiyaṁ jaṭilaṁ imāhi gāthāhi anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā keṇiyam jaṭilam imāhi gāthāhi anumoditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi
translated: After encouraging Keṇiya with these verses, the Buddha got up from his seat and left.

original: Atha kho āyasmā selo sapariso eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto nacirasseva …pe…
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā selaḥ sa parisaḥ ekaḥ vūpakaṭṭhaḥ appamattaḥ ātāpī pahitattaḥ viharantaḥ nacirassa iva pe
translated: Soon afterwards Venerable Selā and his followers, dwelling alone, secluded, heedful, ardent, and resolute, realized the supreme end of the spiritual life for which people from good families rightly go forth from home to the homeless life.

original: aññataro kho panāyasmā selo sapariso arahataṁ ahosi.
analyzed: aññataraḥ kho pana ayasmā selaḥ sa pariso arahatam ahosi
translated: And Venerable Selā became another one of the arahants.

original: Atha kho āyasmā selo sapariso yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā ekaṁsaṁ cīvaraṁ katvā yena bhagavā tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṁ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā selaḥ sa parisaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā ekasam cīvaram katvā yena bhagavā tena añjalim paṇāmetvā bhagavantam gāthāya ajjhabhāsi
translated: He then went to the Buddha, put his upper robe over one shoulder, raise his joined palms, and recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
“We came to you for refuge
on the eighth day, Visionary One.
In seven days, Blessed One,
we were tamed by your instruction.
You’re the Buddha, you’re the teacher,
you’re the sage who’s overcome the demon.

analyzed: tuvam anusaye chetvā  tiṇṇaḥ tāresimam paja
translated: Having cut the underlying tendencies,🔽you’ve crossed over and you liberate people.
You’ve transcended all attachments,
and you’ve smashed the corruptions.
You’re a lion, free from grasping,
free from fear and terror.
“These three hundred monks,
standing with hands raised in reverence,
Hero, extend your feet,
so that the nāgas can worship the Teacher.”🔽The Sela Sutta is the seventh.
